com.jaunt_api
Class Element

java.lang.Object
  com.jaunt_api.Node
      com.jaunt_api.Element
Direct Known Subclasses:
Document, Elements
public class Element
extends Node

This class represents an HTML, XHTML, or XML Element. An Element has an attribute name and may contain attributes (<elementName attributename='attributeValue'>). An element may also have one or more children (which can be other Elements, Comments, or Text), and a single parent. When two elements share the same parent, they are said to be sibling elements with respect to each other. The term "ancestor" refers to any element that rests at or above the level of the element's parent, and the term "descendant" refers to any element at or beneath the level of the element's child/children.

          Returns a String representation of this element's children/descendant nodes as unformatted (ie unindented) XML.
 void innerXML(java.lang.String xml)
          Replaces the contents of this element (ie the descendant nodes) with the specified XML, which is parsed in a matter that ignores the default HTML/XHTML DTD.
 Element nextSiblingElement()
          Retrieves the next sibling Element in the DOM (ie, the next Element that shares the same parent); note that this method is not suitable for iterating through the children of an Elements container, since the those elements may not be siblings in the dom tree.

          Returns a String representation of this element as HTML, including its children/descendants.
 java.lang.String outerXML()
          Returns a String representation of this element (including its children/descendant nodes) as unformatted (ie unindented) XML.

          Retrieves the number of immediate child Nodes.

          Returns a list of immediate child Elements; this method is idiomatically called on a <Elements> container (such as that returned by the findEach/findEvery methods) in order to access search results as a List.

nextSiblingElement

public Element nextSiblingElement()
                           throws NodeNotFound
Retrieves the next sibling Element in the DOM (ie, the next Element that shares the same parent); note that this method is not suitable for iterating through the children of an Elements container, since the those elements may not be siblings in the dom tree.

Returns:

NodeNotFound

getSiblingIndex

public int getSiblingIndex()
Retrieves the sibling index number of this Element (eg, if it's the first child of its parent, it has index 0).

Returns:
the sibling index number of this Element, where only Element children are indexed, with indexing starting at 0, or returns -1 if the element has no parent.

getFirst

public Element getFirst(java.lang.String query)
                 throws NodeNotFound
Searches only immediate child elements and retrieves the first element that was found to match the query.

Parameters:
query - a query that has the general form <tagnameRegex attributeName="attributeValueRegex"> where multiple attributes are allowed. In order for the query to match against an element, the tagnameRegex, attribute name, attributeValueRegex and immediateTextRegex must match if they are specified.
tagnameRegex: If tagnameRegex is a whitespace character, it will match any tagname. Otherwise, the tagnameRegex will be treated as case-insensitive and be evaluated against entire tagnames (ie will not match substrings). The tagnameRegex must begin with either an alphabetical character or a round opening bracket, and may not contain whitespace (though it may contain \\s, which matches whitespace)
attributeName: If no attributes are included in the query, the query will match any attributes in a candidate element (including one without attributes). Otherwise, the attributeName in the query is matched as a case-insensitive string, not as a regular expression.
attributeValueRegex: If attributeValueRegex is not present, the attributeName in the query will be matched against candidate attributeNames irrespective of their attributeValues. If attributeValueRegex is present, it will be treated as case-insensitive and be evaluated against the entire corresponding attribute value (ie will not match substrings)..
immediateTextRegex: If immediateTextRegex is not present, the query will match any immediate child text (including lack of text). Otherwise, immediateTextRegex will be evaluated against the concatenation of immediate Text children of the Element. It's important to note that the immediateTextRegex is case sensitive and will match substrings. The immediateTextRegex, if unquoted, may not contain whitespace (though it may contain \\s, which matches whitespace).
Returns:
first immediate child that matches the specified parameters, or throws a NodeNotFound Exception if one is not found.
Throws:
NodeNotFound

getEach

public Elements getEach(java.lang.String query)
Searches immediate child elements and retrieves those that were found to match the query.

Parameters:
query - a query that has the general form <tagnameRegex attributeName="attributeValueRegex"> where multiple attributes are allowed. In order for the query to match against an element, the tagnameRegex, attribute name, attributeValueRegex and immediateTextRegex must match if they are specified.
tagnameRegex: If tagnameRegex is a whitespace character, it will match any tagname. Otherwise, the tagnameRegex will be treated as case-insensitive and be evaluated against entire tagnames (ie will not match substrings). The tagnameRegex must begin with either an alphabetical character or a round opening bracket, and may not contain whitespace (though it may contain \\s, which matches whitespace)
attributeName: If no attributes are included in the query, the query will match any attributes in a candidate element (including one without attributes). Otherwise, the attributeName in the query is matched as a case-insensitive string, not as a regular expression.
attributeValueRegex: If attributeValueRegex is not present, the attributeName in the query will be matched against candidate attributeNames irrespective of their attributeValues. If attributeValueRegex is present, it will be treated as case-insensitive and be evaluated against the entire corresponding attribute value (ie will not match substrings)..
immediateTextRegex: If immediateTextRegex is not present, the query will match any immediate child text (including lack of text). Otherwise, immediateTextRegex will be evaluated against the concatenation of immediate Text children of the Element. It's important to note that the immediateTextRegex is case sensitive and will match substrings. The immediateTextRegex, if unquoted, may not contain whitespace (though it may contain \\s, which matches whitespace).
Returns:
a container of type Elements holding the elements that were found as a result of the search.

findFirst

public Element findFirst(java.lang.String query)
                  throws NodeNotFound
Searches all child/descendant elements and retrieves the first one found to match the query.

Parameters:
query - a query that has the general form <tagnameRegex attributeName="attributeValueRegex"> where multiple attributes are allowed. In order for the query to match against an element, the tagnameRegex, attribute name, attributeValueRegex and immediateTextRegex must match if they are specified.
tagnameRegex: If tagnameRegex is a whitespace character, it will match any tagname. Otherwise, the tagnameRegex will be treated as case-insensitive and be evaluated against entire tagnames (ie will not match substrings). The tagnameRegex must begin with either an alphabetical character or a round opening bracket, and may not contain whitespace (though it may contain \\s, which matches whitespace)
attributeName: If no attributes are included in the query, the query will match any attributes in a candidate element (including one without attributes). Otherwise, the attributeName in the query is matched as a case-insensitive string, not as a regular expression.
attributeValueRegex: If attributeValueRegex is not present, the attributeName in the query will be matched against candidate attributeNames irrespective of their attributeValues. If attributeValueRegex is present, it will be treated as case-insensitive and be evaluated against the entire corresponding attribute value (ie will not match substrings)..
immediateTextRegex: If immediateTextRegex is not present, the query will match any immediate child text (including lack of text). Otherwise, immediateTextRegex will be evaluated against the concatenation of immediate Text children of the Element. It's important to note that the immediateTextRegex is case sensitive and will match substrings. The immediateTextRegex, if unquoted, may not contain whitespace (though it may contain \\s, which matches whitespace).
Returns:
the first child/descendant element found to match the search parameters or throws a NodeNotFound Exception if one is not found.
Throws:
NodeNotFound

findEach

public Elements findEach(java.lang.String query)
Searches child/descendant elements and retrieves elements that were found to match the query, not including those elements that are children/descendants of any matching elements.

Parameters:
query - a query that has the general form <tagnameRegex attributeName="attributeValueRegex"> where multiple attributes are allowed. In order for the query to match against an element, the tagnameRegex, attribute name, attributeValueRegex and immediateTextRegex must match if they are specified.
tagnameRegex: If tagnameRegex is a whitespace character, it will match any tagname. Otherwise, the tagnameRegex will be treated as case-insensitive and be evaluated against entire tagnames (ie will not match substrings). The tagnameRegex must begin with either an alphabetical character or a round opening bracket, and may not contain whitespace (though it may contain \\s, which matches whitespace)
attributeName: If no attributes are included in the query, the query will match any attributes in a candidate element (including one without attributes). Otherwise, the attributeName in the query is matched as a case-insensitive string, not as a regular expression.
attributeValueRegex: If attributeValueRegex is not present, the attributeName in the query will be matched against candidate attributeNames irrespective of their attributeValues. If attributeValueRegex is present, it will be treated as case-insensitive and be evaluated against the entire corresponding attribute value (ie will not match substrings)..
immediateTextRegex: If immediateTextRegex is not present, the query will match any immediate child text (including lack of text). Otherwise, immediateTextRegex will be evaluated against the concatenation of immediate Text children of the Element. It's important to note that the immediateTextRegex is case sensitive and will match substrings. The immediateTextRegex, if unquoted, may not contain whitespace (though it may contain \\s, which matches whitespace).
Returns:
a container of type Elements holding the elements that were found as a result of the search.

at

public java.lang.String at(java.lang.String attributeName)
Retrieves the attribute value by (case insensitive) attribute name; Unlike getAttributeValue, it returns empty string rather than throw an Exception if the attribute value is not found.

Parameters:
attributeName - case insensitive attribute name.
Returns:
the attribute value, with entity references converted to regular (String) characters, or an empty string if the attribute value was not found.
See Also:
getAttributeValue(String)

delete

public void delete()
Deletes this element and all its children/descendants from the dom tree, and sets this element's parent attribute to null; does nothing if this element is the root element or has no parent.

See Also:
erase()

erase

public void erase()
Removes this element but not this element's children; the children are inserted into this element's parent, starting at the position formerly occupied by this element. Does nothing if this element has no parent.

See Also:
delete()

saveAs

public void saveAs(java.lang.String filename)
            throws java.io.IOException
Saves the current element and it's children/descendants as (UTF-8) HTML in the file specified by the relative filepath. This method is intended for quick-and-dirty saves while debugging.

Parameters:
filename - the path/filename relative to system property user.dir (the current working directory).
Throws:
java.io.IOException

Creates a string representation of the current Element as an XML tag (but not including its children/descendants).

Returns:
an XML representation of this element (not including its children).
See Also:
outerXML()

outerHTML

public java.lang.String outerHTML()
Returns a String representation of this element as HTML, including its children/descendants.

innerHTML

public java.lang.String innerHTML()
Returns a String representation of this element's children/descendant nodes as unformatted (ie unindented) HTML.

innerHTML

public void innerHTML(java.lang.String html)
Replaces the contents of this element (ie the descendant nodes) with the specified HTML (or XHTML), parsed in a matter that utilizes the default HTML DTD.

outerXML

public java.lang.String outerXML()
Returns a String representation of this element (including its children/descendant nodes) as unformatted (ie unindented) XML.

innerXML

public java.lang.String innerXML()
Returns a String representation of this element's children/descendant nodes as unformatted (ie unindented) XML.

innerXML

public void innerXML(java.lang.String xml)
Replaces the contents of this element (ie the descendant nodes) with the specified XML, which is parsed in a matter that ignores the default HTML/XHTML DTD.
